website_summaries.verdict: The speedy My Passport Slim is an excellent mobile backup and storage expansion option. Its rugged, metal-casing design is a great extra, considering its affordable cost.
pros: The compact WD My Passport Slim drive offers fast performance, comes in a metal casing, and is comparatively affordable
cons: The drive could stand to be a little slimmer, especially the 2TB version

customer_reviews.title: First-rate Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mine here on Amazon in February of 2014 and paid $139.00. There's not much to write about this little workhorse of a hard drive that hasn't already been written. I use mine for mirror back-up of my primary laptop. I don't use the software for this purpose that came installed on the My Passport so I can't speak to that feature. The USB 3.0 on this provides for faster data transfer than the USB 3.0 on my. There's nothing about this that I don't like and I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam-I-Am

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it works great, but....
customer_reviews.text: Two things the My Passport Slim Metal is not: slim and metal. Ok, it is ever so very slightly slimmer than the regular My Passport. Maybe half a millimeter. Metal? Not exactly. There is a metal plate on the top of the housing; the rest is plastic, as with the less expensive My Passport. About the only difference I could find between the Passport Slim and the My Passport is that the Passport Slim weights about 2/3 of an ounce more. I own lots of these little WD drives and they're great. But unless there's something magical here, you're paying a premium for a metal case that's mostly plastic and a tiny bit of extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Coronet BlueTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: awesome basic necessasity at an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Very light and very handy. After a lil research, I found out this is the lightest in its domain and within my budget of $70. Have all my documents, movies, music and pictures in it. Got 1 TB since I kinda conserve on saving stuff. Only the ones which are very necessary are kept and the rest is discarded (digital or physical). This cleaning cycle happens every year. For pictures and music we have the cloud storage of various companies anyways. So thought that this is sufficient to hold data for another 4-6 years. Who knows what tech is available then and if this is still in a working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: 18 months old, no problems
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 4 different external HDs of various companies over the years (LaCie, Seagate). They all lasted between several weeks to half a year before they developed corrupted sectors and had to be reformatted again and again. After 12-18 months they had reached the end of their more or less useful lives with me. I've owned this one now by WD for 18 months and it has backed up my Macbook continuously (sometimes several times a day) and retrieved files when needed -- flawlessly. Never needed reformatting. A solid performer in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mick in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drive
customer_reviews.text: Had a smaller (1T) and more basic version of this drive before. Loved it. Ran out of room on the old drive and wanted to stay with a WD Passport product. This drive works very well and is much nicer looking and feeling than the older one. The slim format and brushed metal face make it a real beauty. And, it holds a ton of stuff. Sadly, I am once again running out of room so will be keeping an eye out for the 4T model down the road. A great product. I highly recommend it and the seller from which I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: V. guerena

customer_reviews.title: Fine thus far
customer_reviews.text: This product replaced a Seagate product. I'm happy with it so far, as I am using it solely to back up the contents of my hard drive. My only trepidation is the time required to perform the backup, although it may be a more of a question of my older computer and its USB ports. The utilities and software are easy to setup and use. Instructions are first rate. The unit is quite light and portable, ans it takes up much less space than my old external drive. Hopefully this will last as long as my now defunct Seagate drive.
customer_reviews.author: Neil G.

customer_reviews.title: Still the good version
customer_reviews.text: harder and harder to find the 'good models'; WD came out with some low-fidelty cheap models with 1 vs 3 year warranty. I switched to WD from seagate when (as IT professional) i've had to replace too many laptop 9mm mechanisms; the WD 2T had a 12mm mechanism and was the only one around 'different' well 'big surprise' when it was the ONLY ONE that turned out reliable in the long-term tests. I EXCLUSIVELY use WD passports for computer back-up and only use the 3-year warranty models.
customer_reviews.author: andrewwynn

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Used near daily for a few years now with never a failure. I will add that guaranteeing access to folders when switching between lap tops is problematic: every time I had to try and share and allow access. I was never successful so could only use with my personal lap top.
customer_reviews.author: Littleoleme

customer_reviews.title: "backed up" can be a good thing!
customer_reviews.text: l am very pleased with my WD My Passport Slim 2TB Portable Metal cased back-up drive. It was amazingly simple to install (it pretty much installed itself), and I feel comfortable knowing that I am in control of my back-ups. I had considered one of the on line back-up subscriptions, but wasn't totally confident in sending my data off into the cloud. The unit is so small, that it fits nicely onto my desk between my laptop station and printer. It has amazing capacity, more than I will ever need!
customer_reviews.author: David Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a five years old 256Gb drive
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to replace a still-working 256Gb My Passport portable drive. Eight times the capacity is a nice leap forward and up. So far I can't complain about its performance. Copying this large, 6-10Gb MKV at twice or even thrice the speed is such a plus, though I've noticed transfer speeds vary wildly with file types and sizes. My best hope is this one will last as long as its predecessor, which has proven to be a noble warrior, working since mid-2008. On other notes, the drive looks really nice, well built and solid enough. All I can do is recommend it if you want 2Tb on the palm of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: David Martinez Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very fast!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little drive this unit is. It is very portable, and also very fast. I am getting anywhere between 80 -105 MB/s with this unit. Very fast transfers and definitely USB 3.0! It only needs one USB 3.0 port and it is fully powered. I like that it is metal in order to keep it running cooler for when you are doing large and long transfers. I give it 5 stars! If you want a portable USB 3.0 drive that is fast and works great out of the box, then consider giving this one a try. You will be impressed.
customer_reviews.author: socrates

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software
customer_reviews.text: Instead of having just 1 application with multiple modules, WD installs numerous applications to manage the drive, really over complicating things. They are constantly requiring an update, even after the initial install! Even putting a password on the drive is complex, that should be the easiest thing to do!
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Good pocket backup drive
customer_reviews.text: I use this to shuttle between work and home; I keep it synced with my music drive at work. Good USB 3.0 speed, small enough to fit in a jacket pocket. The downfall of any backup is having it in the same physical location as the system you're backing up: If the house burns down, you lose the computer as well as the backup drive. This, being portable, offers a good alternative to off-site backups. More space than a thumb drive, more speed than a thumb drive, yet still something that's very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. CurmudgeonTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Okay product, but does not backup 'system' files
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything, but can't get My Passport Slim to backup files from my Windows 8.1 "Program Files" folder. It backs up other folder but not system files. Thank God I got the Seagate Slim for redundancy because that external drive did not discriminate on type of folder. Other than that I don't like the user interface of the backup software - took awhile to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: lasgiddi

customer_reviews.title: Crashed in under a year, had to pay for data recovery
customer_reviews.text: I used this drive for video editing files. Even though I had original files backed up on a different drive, I used this one with all the new ones (and hadn't had a chance to back them up yet) 5 weeks out from the film festival, the drive quits. (under a year old). I now have to pay for data recovery and hope that everything is salvagable. Will never buy a WD product again....
customer_reviews.author: Paul Leach

customer_reviews.title: Fully Metallized Case
customer_reviews.text: This thing is slimmer (by a millimeter or two) compared to the standard 2tb units. It accomplishes this by using a full aluminum casing that dissipates heat incredibly well. Has a substantial heft compared to the standard drives (because of the metal). I don't know why they don't use the same case on their entire hard drive line. The included suede bag is nice, but not terribly protective from random bumps and drops. I recommend the ZEROSHOCK case available on eBay or various sellers on AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: DVC

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I have this attached to my MacBook Air.
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive with my MacBook Air to expand it's limited SSD storage. I affixed the small drive to the laptop's cover (low, near the hinge) using super-sticky adhesive strips and then connected using a short USB cord. This set up allows me to move my laptop around without needing an extra hand to hold external HD, and it's always connected -- makes for a convenient setup. HD works great so highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ffass

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This is my first external hard drive so I don't have anything to compare it to. Except for the size. This thing is tiny compared to what I've seen in stores over the years. I find it amazing they can fit 2tb in this thing. Very nice looking unit. Its silent. Gets slightly warm in use. Is alot faster on one of my laptops that has usb 3.0 support. I ripped 25 dvd's to it over the weekend. Still has an enormous amount of space left. I don't think I will ever come close to filling it up. Get it.

customer_reviews.title: Great, Fast little drive.

I really like how it's powered through the USB port as well. I've been using it heavily for about a month with no problems, and even after a few hours of use on end it stays cool to the touch. Will probably end up getting a second as backup.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Failure
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice slim drive, but this drive failed while downloading photos from the cloud less than 8 months after purchase. Apparently the 'thin' version of the HD drive has a proprietary mechanism for recovery, which means that I am now spending hundreds to (try to) recover the data. I was advised by two different repair shops that it is easier to recover data from the thicker version of this drive. I am extremely disappointed in the sensitivity that caused the failure as well as the extra cost and time to try to recover the data. I will be looking into a solid state external drive next time.

I haven't used the included software so I cant give an impression on their functionality. I can say the drive feels sturdy, I toss it in my bad with other things and so far no noticeable scratches or dents. customer_reviews.title: Loved the first one

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Portable External Hard Drive

customer_reviews.title: Great External Drive

A soft black case is also included. No problem so far with Apple TimeMachine (TimeMachine automatically formats the HD). No overheating problem.

product_meta.title: WD My Passport Slim 1TB Portable Metal External Hard Drive USB 3.0 with Auto Backup
product_meta.description:
Capacity:1 TB

MY PASSPORT SLIM PORTABLE STORAGE – SLIM METAL DESIGN WITH LOCAL AND CLOUD BACKUP.
My Passport Slim portable storage features WD SmartWare Pro backup software for local or cloud backup, a beautiful, ultra-slim metal design, the blazing speed of USB 3.0 connectivity and the security of password protection with hardware encryption. Protect your drive from scratches with the included soft pouch.

Ultra-slim, metal design.
Our thinnest drive yet, My Passport Slim is the ideal companion for your Ultrabook or other slim notebook. Thin enough to fit in your briefcase, pocket or purse, it's big enough to carry all your digital content.

Local and cloud backup.
Safeguard your memories with WD SmartWare Pro automatic backup software. Back up directly to this drive or back up to the cloud using Dropbox.

Password protection secures your drive.
Use WD Security to set password protection and hardware encryption and protect your files from unauthorized use or access.

Ultra-fast transfer rates - When connected to a USB 3.0 port, My Passport Slim lets you access and save files in blazing speed. Reduce transfer time by up to 3 times when compared to USB 2.0 transfer rates.*

*Performance may vary based on user's hardware and system configuration.

Automatic backup software - WD SmartWare Pro automatic backup software works quietly in the background to help protect your data using minimal PC resources. Select automatic, continuous backup to instantly back up your files. Or select the scheduled backup option to back up your files on your schedule and take control of your backup.

Local and cloud backup - WD SmartWare Pro lets you choose how you back up your files. Back up your files to your My Passport Slim drive or back up your files to the cloud using your Dropbox account. You can even back up your Dropbox account to the My Passport Slim drive for double protection.

Dropbox account required for cloud backup. Cloud services may be changed, terminated or interrupted at any time and may vary by country.

Works great with Windows 8 - WD's Windows 8 app makes it easy to discover the digital media stored on your My Passport Slim drive with your Windows 8 computer. Your content is automatically displayed and organized so you can easily locate and enjoy your photos, videos and music.

USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 compatibility - With this single drive you get compatibility with the latest USB 3.0 devices and backward compatibility with USB 2.0 devices as well.

WD Drive Utilities - Register your drive, set drive timer, run diagnostics and more using WD Drive Utilities.

Soft pouch included - The included soft pouch helps protect your drive from scratches.

Durable enclosure protects the drive inside - We know your data is important to you. So we build the drive inside to our demanding requirements for durability, shock tolerance, and long-term reliability. Then, we protect the drive with a durable enclosure designed for beauty.

USB-powered - Powered directly from the USB port on your PC. No separate power supply is needed.

Ideal for

 * Transferring files in blazing fast speed with USB 3.0
 * Connecting to the latest USB 3.0 devices and even backward compatible with USB 2.0 devices
 * Backing up your files to the local drive with automatic backup software
 * Backing up your files to the cloud using Dropbox
 * Adding extra storage for your videos, music, photos, and files.
 * Securing your files from unauthorized access with password protection and hardware encryption
 * Connecting and powering through your USB 3.0 or USB 2.0 interface

What's in the box
Portable hard drive, USB cable, WD SmartWare Pro software, soft pouch, Quick Install Guide.

Compatibility
Formatted NTFS + Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP operating systems
Requires reformatting for Mac OS X
Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system.

Features at a glance

 * Ultra-compact metal design with plenty of storage
 * Automatic backup software for local backups
 * Cloud backup through Dropbox
 * Blazing-fast data transfers with USB 3.0 interface
 * USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 compatibility
 * Password protection and hardware encryption
